Ad Text:
We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Data Manager to lead the Data and Insights team nestled within our Strategy and Engagement Portfolio.

Our ideal candidate will be passionate about the power of data, a proven leader, excellent analytical and problem solving skills; turning information into meaningful insights that shape strategy and support decision-making across the organisation.

If this sounds an opportunity made for you,  we invite you to join the Victorian Catholic Education Authority (VCEA) as our Manager, Data and Insights.

Why work with VCEA

As the peak body for Catholic education in Victoria, VCEA provides employees an opportunity to help shape the future of Catholic education across the state.

VCEA is the voice of Catholic education in State and national matters; we receive and distribute funding from state and federal governments for Catholic schools. Providing strategic leadership and planning to ensure proper governance in Catholic education statewide.

VCEA offers a purpose built new central city office location, 5 minutes walk to Parliament Station. Competitive remuneration (reflecting your experience), with generous benefits, and opportunities for career development. 

These benefits combined with our commitment to work life balance make VCEA an employer of choice.

What you will do

Nestled within the Strategy and Engagement Portfolio, the Data and Insights team plays a key role in supporting the VCEA’s strategic leadership.

The Manager, Data and Insights will provide strategic leadership and manage VCEA’s work in collecting, extracting and analysing data and related research, creating valuable insights for VCEA.

They will also play a critical role in VCEA’s data governance practices and capabilities, and VCEA’s data lake.

What you’ll bring

Expertise to shape VCEA’s data and analytics strategy, ensuring insights align with organisational goals and sector priorities.

Strong leadership skills, with experience guiding and developing a team of data and research professionals in a supportive and growth-focused environment.

A collaborative approach to building strong relationships with partners such as VCAA, MACS and other education stakeholders, underpinned by an understanding of data privacy regulations and governance practices.

The capacity to oversee robust data governance frameworks and promote data literacy across the organisation, driving continuous improvement and innovation in reporting and analysis.

Confidence in presenting complex data clearly to diverse audiences, including executive leaders and boards.

A proactive and detail-oriented mindset, with a track record of delivering high-quality outcomes in a fast-paced and evolving environment.

Qualifications and Experience

Minimum 7 years demonstratable experience in a similar strategy, business intelligence or data analytics role.

Advanced technical capability across Microsoft Office, Power BI, SQL and statistical tools such as Python/R.

Demonstrable experience managing large and complex data sets, with high attention to detail and commitment to data quality and integrity.

Prior experience managing teams, including managing workloads, providing coaching and quality assurances and building a positive work culture.

Tertiary qualifications in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Econometrics or a related field.

A note on inclusion and how to apply

If you are ready to make a difference in Victorian Catholic education, please submit your resume and a cover letter demonstrating how your skills and experience align with our requirements and make you the standout applicant for this role.

The full position description can be found by navigating to our website: https://vcea.catholic.edu.au/about-us/work-with-us/

We are committed to ensuring our recruitment process is inclusive and accessible for anyone who wishes to apply.

If you would like further information about this role, or require any adaptations or additional support for your individual circumstances so you can perform at your best during the application or recruitment process please reach out to: hrassist@vcea.catholic.edu.au

Advertising is scheduled to end on: 6 October 2025

We will be reviewing applications as they are received. Should we we find a suitable applicant we will close the role early; therefore please don't delay your application.  

Due to the volume of applications received; only successful applicants will be contacted.

Successful candidates will be required to undergo a pre-employment National Police History check, obtain a Working with Children Check and provide evidence of Australian Citizenship or Visa.

Power BI Consultant – Power Apps & Automation Focus

We are seeking a motivated and highly skilled Power BI Consultant for an immediate-start 3-month contract engagement. The ideal candidate will bring deep experience in building impactful business intelligence solutions, with advanced capabilities in Data Modelling and Dashboards.

This role is particularly suited to candidates who excel at bridging technical development with business needs, and who can deliver end-to-end analytics and low-code solutions with minimal supervision in fast-paced, project-driven environments.

Key Responsibilities:

Dashboard Design & Development: Build, enhance, and maintain enterprise-grade Power BI dashboards and reports, applying UX best practices and data visualisation principles.

Design, develop, and maintain Power BI dashboards and reports that deliver clear and actionable insights.

Build and optimise data models (DAX, Power Query, M language) to support enterprise-level reporting.

Partner with stakeholders to gather requirements, translate them into technical specifications, and deliver solutions that meet business needs.

Implement best practices for Power BI governance, including dataset certification, row-level security, and workspace management.

Integration & Sourcing: Connect Power BI reports to a variety of data sources including SQL Server, SharePoint, Excel, and APIs.

Collaboration & Delivery: Engage with stakeholders to gather requirements, prototype solutions, and support user testing and deployment.

Documentation & Support: Develop high-quality documentation for solutions, processes, and user guides, enabling sustainable handover and knowledge sharing.

Governance & Best Practice: Apply governance frameworks, naming conventions, and security best practices across Power Platform solutions.

Requirements:

Must have Australian working rights.

Experience: 5–10 years in analytics, reporting, or business intelligence roles.

Proven experience delivering Power BI solutions in an enterprise setting.

Technical Skills:

Advanced proficiency in DAX, Power Query (M), and Data Modelling.

Implement best practices for Power BI governance, including dataset certification, row-level security, and workspace management.

Drive automation and efficiency by integrating data from multiple sources (SQL, Azure, Databricks, Snowflake cloud-based warehouses).

Comfortable working with REST APIs and integrating various data services.

Stakeholder Engagement: Confident communicator with the ability to understand business problems and translate them into technical solutions.

Availability: Must be available for immediate start on a full-time 3-month contract.

Delivery Experience: Prior experience in agile or hybrid delivery models, ideally with project exposure in finance, operations, or HR domains.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience embedding Power BI into SharePoint or Teams.

Exposure to Power BI Service administration and workspace management.

Experience of having worked with Qlik, SAP, Databricks, Snowflake & Denodo is a bonus.

Why Join Us?

Impactful Projects: Work on high-visibility business intelligence solutions that empower enterprise decision-making.

Modern Tooling: Leverage the latest in Power Platform technologies in a supportive environment.

Agile, Fast-Moving Culture: Join a team that delivers meaningful outcomes quickly, with direct stakeholder engagement.

Flexible Work Environment: Hybrid contract with a pragmatic and delivery-first approach.

Careers with Impact

More than one million Australians trust HESTA with their money. HESTA is a top-performing industry super fund working for real-world impact. We use our expertise and influence to deliver strong long-term returns while accelerating our contribution to a more sustainable world.

HESTA is also an inspiring and rewarding place to work. That's because what we do makes a difference to the lives of our members. The people who work at HESTA are not only exceptional at what they do, they're focused on living and creating a strong organisational culture. We're an industry super fund dedicated to the people who keep our communities going. People who provide some of the best health, education and community services in the world are HESTA members - and we are proud to serve them.





Bring your authentic and passionate self to this exceptional role #careerswithimpact


As the Senior Analyst - Investment Performance, you'll play a crucial role in delivering independent investment performance reporting and attribution analysis. You'll work directly with investment management and execution teams to provide valuable insights that drive strategic decision-making.

In this role you will be a subject matter expert in Investment Performance and deliver impactful performance insights across portfolios, asset classes and investment options that will be integrated into the development of investment strategy. You will develop and maintain performance measurement and attribution models and ensure the accuracy and integrity of performance databases. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with investment managers on investment reviews and investment committee presentations and contribute to system and reporting improvement initiatives.

Please note this role could be based in Melbourne or Sydney.

About you

Significant experience in investment performance analysis and reporting and a strong understanding of attribution models and methodologies, including Fixed Income attribution, is essential for success in this role. You will have a comprehensive knowledge of regulatory requirements for superannuation fund investment reporting and working knowledge of complex financial instruments and their performance measurement.

Required technical skills include proficiency with investment platforms (e.g., Simcorp, Bloomberg, Factset), advanced SQL/Python and experience with data visualisation tools such as Powerbi. You will have excellent stakeholder management and communication skills, advanced analytical and problem-solving capabilities and a in depth understanding of superannuation investment structures.

Benefits that matter and make a difference for our employees


• Leave for those moments that matter, an additional 6 days of leave at the end of year, up to 6 days paid volunteer leave, gender neutral paid parental leave of 20 weeks, Gender Affirmation leave, reproductive health and wellbeing leave, Cultural and Ceremonial leave. Access your LSL after 3 years, take AL at half pay, and purchase up to 2 weeks additional leave (just to name a few!).


• Your Professional development matters, up to $5k per year professional development and up to 8 days professional development leave, HESTA scholarships and free access to a range of premium learning tools.


• Your health and wellbeing matters, free annual flu shots and skin checks, incredible social events throughout the year and a comprehensive employee assistance program available 24/7.


• Your financial wellbeing matters, up to 15% super, financial planning support, end of year payment for all Enterprise Agreement-covered employees, incentivised Employee Referral Program and novated lease options.

We celebrate, value and include people of all backgrounds, genders, identities, cultures and abilities. We welcome and support applications from First Nations people, physically, neuro or culturally diverse, LGBTQI+, and people of any age. We are proud to be WGEA accredited as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equity.


We want all candidates to feel safe, included and provided with the best opportunity to thrive, if you require reasonable adjustments during your application or throughout the recruitment process, please reach out to a member of the Talent team careers@hesta.com.au and we'll call you to discuss.


Please note: Applications via recruitment agencies will not be accepted for this position





Key role supporting investment management, responsible for independent investment performance reporting and attribution analysis

Ad Text:
Full Time Limited Term (2 years)

Total Remuneration Package: $145,000 - $150,000 inclusive of superannuation

Location: Werribee 

About Southern Rural Water

Southern Rural Water (SRW) is a Victorian water corporation with nearly 170 staff, managing major dams, weirs, water licencing and more from Mallacoota through to the South Australian border. At SRW, we believe that diversity makes us stronger, and we are committed to creating an inclusive workplace where everyone feels respected, valued, and empowered to thrive and contribute to collective success. Through providing a flexible, always safe workplace and promoting employee development, we empower employees to contribute to our strategy of great value for customers and community through excellence in rural water management.

How We Support You

At Southern Rural Water, we recognise and prioritise the wellbeing and fulfillment of our staff members. Here's what we offer to ensure a balanced and rewarding work experience:

Embrace flexibility: We support various working arrangements including WFH, 9-day fortnights, tailor your work schedule to accommodate for school drop off and pick up hours.
Generous leave provisions: 15 days sick leave and 14 weeks paid parental leave to support you during life’s important moments!
Health and Wellbeing: Yearly reimbursement of up to $150 per financial year to support you in physical, mental and financial wellbeing.
Professional development: We support your growth through a range of internal and external training initiatives and offer study assistance programs to empower you to reach your full potential.
Employee Assistance Program: Receive comprehensive support for yourself and your family through our employee assistance program.
Salary Sacrifice: Salary Sacrifice options for vehicles, equipment, and superannuation to enhance your financial benefits. 
See what else we can offer you on our Careers Page!



About the Role

Southern Rural Water is currently seeking a dynamic Lead Business Analyst to drive our business analysis function within our Digital Futures Program, covering Enterprise Resources Planning (ERP), Operational Technology (OT), data, and integration projects. This is a unique opportunity to lead business analysis at scale and shape the success of SRW’s digital transformation.

In this role, you will shape how business needs are captured, validated, and translated into functional and non-functional requirements, ensuring every initiative aligns with SRW’s strategic objectives, technology architecture, and regulatory obligations.

As the Lead BA, your leadership will be key to enabling robust, end to end project delivery and driving long term business value. You will play a crucial role in mentoring junior analysts and supporting business analysis activities while ensuring the consistent delivery of high-quality business requirements, process maps, data models, and solution designs.

As the Lead Business Analyst, some of your responsibilities will include:

Lead business analysis activities across ERP and major technology projects, ensuring consistency of approach, artefacts, and quality.
Oversee development of Business Requirements Specifications (BRS), Functional and Non-Functional Requirements, User Stories, and Acceptance Criteria.
Translate complex business needs into clear solution designs, ensuring alignment with SRW’s enterprise architecture, data, and integration standards.
Lead quality assurance and software testing across ERP and major technology projects, ensuring solutions are fit-for-purpose, reliable, and aligned to business requirements.
Develop, implement, and continuously improve SRW’s business analysis and software testing frameworks, toolsets, and methodologies to ensure a standardised and fit-for-purpose approach.

About you

The successful candidate for this position will be able to demonstrate some of the desired experience and abilities below:

A degree or equivalent qualification in Business, Information Technology, Engineering or a related discipline.
Extensive business analysis experience across ERP (Major Platforms i.e. Microsoft, TechnologyOne, CIVICA), OT (Telemetry, SCADA, IoT), data, GIS, and digital transformation projects.
Proven ability to lead analysis through the full project lifecycle, from requirements and process mapping to integration, testing, cutover, and transition to BAU.
Deep working knowledge of enterprise platforms and integrations (Microsoft Azure, M365, Microsoft Dynamics, TechnologyOne,) with strong awareness of cybersecurity, data governance, and compliance in regulated environments.
Demonstrated experience developing and implementing business analysis and testing frameworks to ensure consistency and quality.

How to Apply

Applications should be made online by clicking 'Apply' before midnight Sunday 14 September 2025 or by visiting our website: www.srw.com.au

Please take the time to describe how your knowledge, skills and abilities would make you a suitable candidate for this role as part of your cover letter.

A Position Description for this position can be obtained from this link.

Southern Rural Water is committed to diversity and inclusion in employment and is proud to encourage applications from people of different backgrounds, abilities, ages, genders, gender identities and/or sexual orientations.

Southern Rural Water acknowledges the Traditional Owners of the lands and waters we work with and within, and pay respects to Elders past and present.

We welcome applications from people with disability and aim to provide an inclusive and accessible workplace. If you need any help with the application process or would like to discuss your reasonable adjustments during interviews, please contact: peopleandculture@srw.com.au
